SEARCH
Package org.rcmd.jneuroformats

Class FsSurface

java.lang.Object
org.rcmd.jneuroformats.FsSurface
All Implemented Interfaces:
IMesh
public class FsSurface extends Object implements IMesh
Represents a FreeSurfer surface, i.e. a triangular mesh consisting of a set of vertices and a set of faces. In the context of neuroimaging, meshes are typically used to store brain surface reconstructions, e.g., the cortical surface reconstructed from a T1-weighted MRI scan.

  • Field Details

    • mesh

      public Mesh mesh
      The mesh data

    • commentLine

      public String commentLine
      Metadata, a comment line that is part of the FreeSurfer surface file format. Typically contains information on how and when the file was created.

    • createdLine

      public String createdLine
      Metadata, a created line that is part of the FreeSurfer surface file format. Typically contains information on how and when the file was created, but is often empty.

  • Constructor Details

    • FsSurface

      public FsSurface()
      Create an empty surface.

    • FsSurface

      public FsSurface(Mesh mesh)
      Constructor that takes a Mesh object.
      Parameters:
      mesh - the mesh object containing vertices and faces.

    • FsSurface

      public FsSurface(ArrayList<float[]> vertices, ArrayList<int[]> faces)
      Constructor that takes a list of vertices and a list of faces.
      Parameters:
      vertices - the mesh vertices, as x,y,z coordinates.
      faces - the mesh faces, as indices into the vertex list. The mesh is assumed to be triangular.

  • Method Details

    • read

      public static FsSurface read(Path filePath) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException
      Read a file in MZ3, PLY, or FreeSurfer mesh format and return an FsSurface object.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the name of the file to read, as a Path object. Get on from a string by something like `java.nio.file.Paths.Path.get("myfile.ply")`. The file format will be determined from the file extension.
      Returns:
      an FsSurface object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.
      FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist.
      See Also:
      • if you want to read a file and specify the format.

    • readFormat

      public static FsSurface readFormat(Path filePath, String format) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException
      Read a file in MZ3, PLY, or FreeSurfer mesh format and return an FsSurface object.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the name of the file to read, as a Path object. Get on from a string by something like `java.nio.file.Paths.Path.get("myfile.mgz")`. The file format will be determined from the file extension if parameter `format` is set to `auto`.
      format - the file format to read, either "mz3", "ply", "surf", or "auto" to auto-detect from the file name.
      Returns:
      an FsSurface object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.
      FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist.
      See Also:
      • if you want to read a file without specifying the format.

    • fromFsSurfaceFile

      protected static FsSurface fromFsSurfaceFile(Path filePath) throws IOException
      Read a file in FreeSurfer surface format and return a FsSurface object.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the name of the file to read, as a Path object. Get on from a string by something like `java.nio.file.Paths.Path.get("myfile.txt")`.
      Returns:
      an FsSurface object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.

    • writeSurface

      protected void writeSurface(Path filePath) throws IOException
      Write this mesh to a file in FreeSurfer surface format.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file to write to
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.

    • write

      public void write(Path filePath, String format) throws IOException
      Write this mesh to a file in PLY, OBJ or FreeSurfer surf format.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file to write to
      format - the format to write to, either "ply", "obj", or "surf". Alternatively, "auto" to derive the format from the filePath.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.
